réé en 1966 avec un capital initial de 15 millions de dinars. En 1985, le Crédit Populaire d’Algérie donne naissance à la banque de développpement local par cession de 40 agences, le transfert de 550 employés et cadres et 89 000 comptes clientèle. Défini par ses statuts comme banque universelle, le Crédit Populaire d’Algérie a pour missions de promouvoir le développement de BTPH, les secteurs de la santé et du médicament, le commerce et la distribution, l’hôtelerie et le tourisme, les médias, la PME/PMI et l’artisanat.

Conformément à la réglementation en vigueur en Algérie, le Crédit Populaire d’Algérie traite les opérations de crédits et de banque ; il peut recevoir des dépôts, accorder des crédits sous toutes ses formes, prendre des participations dans le capital de toutes entreprises, mobiliser pour le compte d’autrui tous crédits consentis par d’autres institutions. Suite à la promulgation de la loi sur l’autonomie des entreprises en 1988, le Crédit Populaire d’Algérie est devenu une Entreprise publique économique par actions dont le capital est propriété exclusive de l’état. Depuis 1996, en vertu de l’ordonnance relative à la gestion des capitaux marchands de l’Etat, les banques publiques sont placées sous tutelle du ministère des Finances. Le capital social de la banque, initialement fixé à 15 millions de dinars, a atteint 29.3 milliards DA en 2006.

name: Credit Suisse First Boston
description: Credit Suisse First Boston was the investment banking division of Credit Suisse Group, prior to 2006. It was active in investment banking, capital markets and financial services.In 2006, as part of a major rebranding exercise to communicate as an integrated organization - 'Credit Suisse' to clients, employees and shareholders; the group retired the 'First Boston' name and amalgamated the CSFB operations to the newly reorganized investment banking division of Credit Suisse.HistoryCredit Suisse/First Boston 50/50 JV (1978–1988)In 1978, Credit Suisse and First Boston Corporation formed a London-based 50-50 investment banking joint venture called the Financière Crédit Suisse-First Boston. This joint venture later became the operating name of Credit Suisse's investment banking operations.Transition to CSFB (1988–1997)Credit Suisse acquired a 44% stake in First Boston in 1988. The investment bank acquired its shares held by the public and the company was taken private. In 1989, the junk bond market collapsed, leaving First Boston unable to redeem hundreds of millions it had lent for the leveraged buyout of Ohio Mattress Company, maker of Sealy mattresses, a deal that became known as "the burning bed". Credit Suisse bailed them out and acquired a controlling stake in 1990. Although such an arrangement was arguably illegal under the Glass–Steagall Act, the Federal Reserve, the U.S. bank regulator, concluded that the integrity of the financial markets was better served by avoiding the bankruptcy of a significant investment bank like First Boston even though it meant a de facto merger of a commercial bank with an investment bank.

name: Mountain America Credit Union
description: Mountain America Credit Union is a federally chartered credit union headquartered in West Jordan, Utah, regulated under the authority of the National Credit Union Administration (NCUA). Mountain America Credit Union is the second largest credit union in Utah. It is also the 12th largest credit union nationally by membership and the 24th largest by total assets. As of March 2015, Mountain America had $4.479 billion in assets, 522,661 members, native 82 branches, and more than 5,000 shared branch locations available.HistoryMountain America Credit Union is a member-owned, not-for-profit, full-service financial institution providing Savings, Checking, Consumer financing, Insurance, Retirement planning, Business services, and SBA loans. Mountain America is a federally chartered credit union, regulated by the National Credit Union Administration (NCUA), an agency of the federal government. Savings are federally insured to at least $250,000 per account and are backed by the full faith and credit of the United States Government. Mountain America was founded in 1934 as the Utah Telephone Credit Union to serve telephone workers from AT&T, Mountain Bell, Salt Lake Telephone and Western Electric. In May 1984, the credit union changed its name to Mountain America Credit Union. Later that year, Mountain America absorbed Postal Workers Credit Union and Entra Credit Union. In 1988, Mountain America merged with Utah State Credit Union, becoming the second largest credit union in Utah and setting our course as a modern, full-service financial institution.Due to a hostile environment created by Utah lawmakers, namely a 5% proposed tax on the 3 largest credit unions in Utah, Mountain America converted from a state chartered to a federally chartered credit union in 2003, becoming Mountain America Federal Credit Union. Mountain America's membership is open to residents of Salt Lake, Duchesne, Wasatch, and Uintah counties and their families as well as members of affiliated associations and employees of select employee groups. Some of their Select Employer Group (SEG) affiliations include some of the world's largest companies and associations, including Marriott International, the National Consumer Council, and Walmart.

name: Credit Direct Limited
description:
Credit Direct Limited is a non-bank finance company with its Head-Quarters in Lagos, Nigeria. It was established in 2007 and is focused on providing Payroll based Micro Consumer loans to validly employed civil servants in Nigeria with a view to expanding her target market to incorporate the private sector and then create footprints across Africa. The Company currently operates in 21 states in Nigeria including the Federal Capital Territory – Abuja.

With a staff strength of over 1000 employees and an active customer base of over 150,000, CDL is positioning itself to become the dominant market leader in the unsecured micro-lending (payroll lending) space in Nigeria and indeed Sub-Saharan Africa.

The Company’s 24- hour unsecured emergency loan product is its flagship product and the core of the business representing more than 99% of its EBITDA. In 2011, it introduced its Asset based loans product which offers customers the opportunity to purchase house-hold items and also accommodate certain segments of the market which are averse to interest bearing loans.

Global Credit Rating Company a renowned Credit Rating Company in 2012 gave the company a “stable outlook” rating.

name: Campus USA Credit Union
description:
Welcome to the CAMPUS USA Credit Union Facebook page. We’re glad you want to connect and get to know us better! We encourage you to share your experiences, suggest improvements, and connect. Please review our community guidelines, created to foster a productive, secure and fun experience for everyone:

1. Protect your private information. The security of your account is just as important to us as it is to you! Please do not post any of your specific account details on our public Facebook page. For questions about your account, please call us at 800-335-9090 or visit one of our service centers. 

2. Please be respectful. We believe in the open-door policy and understand that not everyone will agree with each other 100% of the time. If you disagree with content posted by CAMPUS USA Credit Union or another Facebook user please be kind and respectful with your words. We reserve the right to remove any content we consider to be abusive, unproductive, offensive, or unlawful. 

3. Let’s be honest! Please only post information that you know to be truthful, accurate and that you have the legal right to publish. This includes copyrighted material, by submitting any content to our Facebook page you are assumed to be the owner of that property or you have the owner’s permission to use their property. 

4. No advertising allowed. Your comments should stay on topic. We reserve the right to remove comments or wall posts which are intended to sell a product or service, or posted just to drive traffic to a particular website for personal, political, or monetary gain. 

5. Disclaimer. Facebook is owned by a third party unaffiliated with CAMPUS USA Credit Union. CAMPUS USA Credit Union is not responsible for the privacy or security policies at these sites or other third party sites that may be linked to from within them.

name: Sunova Credit Union
description:
Sunova is a vibrant, innovative and friendly full service financial institution dedicated to providing outstanding member service. We are represented by a unified team of individuals committed to one common goal - to develop a life-long relationship with each member built on mutual trust, financial expertise and our genuine desire to help our members achieve their financial goals. Each encounter with our organization is a memorable experience showcasing our distinctive and unique service offering.

The D.O.Gs
At Sunova we love our members so much that we want to give you a kiss every time you come into one of our branches. That’s right, every time you stop by, one of our employees will be waiting and ready to give you a big, wet smooch. 

Did we forget to mention that kisses are only provided by the adorable (and oh so fluffy) St. Bernards we’ve hired to work full time as Directors of Greetings (or D.O.Gs for short) in our branches?

These D.O.Gs have a very important job here at Sunova that includes greeting members, sleeping, playing with kids that come into the branch, sleeping, occasionally providing comic relief and of course providing big slobbery kisses when necessary! 

All of the D.O.Gs are in-branch on a regular basis throughout the week. 

For branch locations and hours of operation, check out our website: www.sunovacu.ca/locations.

name: Guardian Credit Union
description:
Guardian Credit Union is a not-forprofit financial cooperative, owned and managed by and for its members; committed to providing quality financial services at the lowest possible cost; and driven by a purpose to serve people.
Since 1934 it has been our mission to become our member’s primary financial institution by providing superior, comprehensive, courteous, and prompt
service.

In the past, credit unions offered services exclusively to employees of large organizations. In 1986 Guardian Credit Union opened its doors to the general public. We now serve over 34,000 members in Milwaukee, Waukesha, Washington, Racine, Kenosha, Walworth, and Ozaukee counties. Our range of services has grown from the initial simple savings and loans to today’s services which include checking, mortgages, online and mobile services, credit cards, ATM accessibility, and so much more.

Guardian Credit Union's commitment to serve our members and our financial stability has helped us remain an established part of the community and credit union movement.

name: Seattle Metropolitan Credit Union
description:
Since 1933, Seattle Metropolitan Credit Union has operated by the 7 Cooperative Principles to provide financial services to the employees and family members of the City of Seattle. Since then, we have expanded our charter to include anyone who lives or works in the state of Washington.

Seattle Metropolitan Credit Union is a not-for-profit financial cooperative. When individuals become members of a credit union, they become equal shareholders, each with one vote to elect their volunteer Board of Directors and Supervisory Committee. These volunteers oversee a professional management team and overall credit union operations. 

Seattle Metropolitan Credit Union's existence reflects its members' combined interests to continue operation for the benefit of the general membership in the local communities we serve. We provide a full spectrum of financial products and services, returning profit to our members in the form of lower loan rates and higher savings rates, low fees, and innovative products and services. This direct financial value is given back to our members instead of being paid to a limited number of stockholders, officers, or out-of-state owners as many banks do.

name: Biz2Credit
description:
Founded in 2007, Biz2Credit (www.biz2credit.com), is an online small business platform that connects small business owners with financing options from over 1,100 lenders. Our easy four minute application collects a few key pieces of information that are used to connect business owners with the very best loan options for their business. Business owners can view their loan matches for free.  

Our platform is a safe and price transparent environment that is used by over 1,100 major banks in the US, credit rating agencies like Dun & Bradstreet, as well as major SMB service providers like Dell. Biz2Credit was ranked among 100 top emerging companies in the US by KPMG and Stanford University in 2008 as well as the No. 1 financing resource by Entrepreneur magazine in the fall of 2009. With over $800+ million in funding and over 150,000 SMB users in the US, we are the market leader in this space.

name: Creditwest Bank
description:
Bugün finans sektörüne getirdiği yeniliklerle öncü bir güç olma yolunda ilerleyen Creditwest Bank, 1993 yılında Altınbaş Bank adıyla Kıbrıs’ta kuruldu.

Müşterilerine sunduğu finansal çözümler ile başarısını her geçen gün artıran Creditwest ,toplam aktiflerinde son 7 yılda ortalama yıllık %30 oranında bir büyüme grafiği gösterdi ve Kıbrıs bankacılık sektöründen ortalama 3 kat daha fazla büyüdü.2013 yıl sonu itibariyle Creditwest Bank Kıbrıs 14 şubesi ile aktif toplamını 1.160 milyon TL’ye ve öz kaynakları toplamını 82 milyon TL’nin üzerine çıkararak Kuzey Kıbrıs’taki özel sermayeli bankalar arasında birinci sıraya yükseldi.

Uluslararası muhasebe standartlarına uygun hareket etmeye ve şeffaflığa büyük önem veren Banka’nın rating notu;JCR (Uluslararası Derecelendirme Kuruluşu) tarafından 2013 yılında ‘yüksek seviyede yatırım yapılabilir’ seviyesini gösteren ‘AA+’ya yükseldi.Creditwest Bank Kıbrıs,bu gün finans alanındaki başarılı projelerine artan bir büyüme potansiyeli ile devam ediyor.

JCR Eurasia Rating'ın 2013 yılına ait raporuna göre Creditwest Bank 22 bankanın faaliyet gösterdiği Kuzey Kıbrıs bankacılık sektöründe en büyük 3. Banka, özel sermayeli bankalar arasında ise en büyük 1. banka konumuna yükselmiştir. .

name: UniCredit
description: UniCredit Group is an Italian global banking and financial services company. Its network spanning 50 markets in 17 countries, with more than 8,500 branches and over 147,000 employees. Its strategic position in Western and Eastern Europe gives the group one of the region's highest market shares.GeographyThe company has its registered office in Rome and general management in Milan. UniCredit's core markets are Italy, Austria, Russia, Southern Germany and Bulgaria. The UniCredit Group has investment banking divisions in New York, London, Hong Kong, Milan, Munich, Vienna, Budapest and Warsaw.With the goal of fostering trade and investment between Eastern and Western Europe, UniCredit has joined up with Ost-Ausschuss der Deutschen Wirtschaft and the Federal State of Berlin to host the east forum Berlin.HistoryUniCredit Group was the outcome of the 1998 merger of several Italian banks, which the majority one were Unicredito (banks from Turin, Verona and Treviso) and Credito Italiano, hence the name Unicredito Italiano. Other banks such as Banca dell'Umbria, Cassa di Risparmio di Carpi, Cassa di Risparmio di Trento e Rovereto (Caritro), Cassa di Risparmio di Trieste also merged into the group in 1998–99.

name: Credit Blueprint
description: There is no magic wand that someone can wave over your credit report to erase years of poor credit. Our program is broken down in two simple parts. To work on your behalf and with the credit bureau's to remove questionable items. Secondly to educate you how your score is what it is and more importantly how to always be increasing your scores even after the program has ended. Your participation is a going to be a big part of your results so please don't sit back and relax like most companies advise you. Also be cautious of companies that charge you on a monthly basis with the intent to stretch your program out over 6 to 12 months only disputing 5 negative items a month. Credit Blueprint will dispute all your negative items at once with the credit bureaus and creditors.

name: Really Easy Car Credit

All you need to do to apply is go to www.reallyeasycarcredit.co.uk
and fill out the form. 

Once you have been pre approved we will then call you to arrange an appointment for you to come down and choose your new car.

Isn't that Really Easy!

As one of Alabama's largest financial institutions, we are committed to improving the lives of our members by promoting financial well-being, and supporting and strengthening the communities in which we serve.

This Page is a reliable, real-time resource for our members to ask questions, discover personal finance tips and stay updated on AFFCU news, contests and promotions. Page administrators will respond to questions and urgent situations during normal business hours. We will be as prompt as possible for inquiries made over a holiday or weekend. General, non-account related questions will be resolved in the appropriate message thread. If your inquiry is account specific or requires additional research, we will need to move the conversation to email or phone for privacy and confidentiality purposes.

* Do not provide personal, confidential or account-related details on our Facebook Page. We will immediately remove this type of content for your safety. If you need assistance with your account, contact us by using the private message feature, emailing us at memberservices@amfirst.org, or contacting our call center during business hours at (205) 320-4000.

* Comments that include personal information, offensive language, personal attacks, or that are considered spam by Page administrators will be removed for the safety of our members and online community.

America's First is Federally Insured by NCUA. Rates and products available to qualifying applicants only. Equal Housing Lender. Certain restrictions apply.

name: Coulter Credit Counseling LLC
description:
When is the last time you saw your Credit Report? Everyone is entitled to a credit report for free once a year from all 3 agencies ( Transunion, Equifax & Experian) Did you know that a bad credit score can cause one to pay higher interest rates on Auto Loans, Mortgages, Personal Loans, Credit Cards, some insurance companies will even charge you higher premiums if you have a low credit score! According to the Federal Trade Commission an estimated 10 million consumers have erroneous (false/wrong) information on their personal credit file. According to Credit Report.com "Studies show that a high percentage of consumer credit reports - up to 70 percent - contain errors".  Most people will not even look at their credit report until it is too late and they have already applied/been denied for credit. Be proactive in knowing the information on your report so you know before you apply for credit that all the information is correct. Just by doing that one can save thousands of dollars that would be paid in higher interest rates.

Cleaning up your credit report is a gradual process. It involves disputing erroneous information in your personal credit file. Some can have results in as few as days but most will take 30 days to return the results of an investigation. If the agency reporting information on your credit report does not reply to the Credit Reporting Agency's request to verify the account it has to be deleted. If the investigation verifies that the information is yours, and you have proof that it is definitively not yours,one can seek the expertise of a consumer lawyer to take legal action against the agency reporting erroneous information and causing harm to your good name.

http://www.consumerfinance.gov/newsroom/

name: Alabama Teachers Credit Union
description:
About Us
We Are All Teachers
Who is Alabama Teachers Credit Union? We are your neighbors, your friends and your family. We are T-ball coaches, shoelace tiers, car pool drivers…and your financial partner. We are also teachers. In fact, each one of us is a teacher in his or her own way. And while we may not be in a conventional classroom setting, we all teach, learn and share everyday life moments--whether it is with family, friends or co-workers. We are all teachers, with life lessons to share, and opportunities to learn.

Our History
Alabama Teachers Credit Union was organized in March 1959 with just two employees, and was located on the second floor of the Gadsden City Board of Education Building. Previously known as Etowah Teachers Credit Union, our original Select Employee Group (SEG) was only open to employees and family members of the Gadsden City and Etowah County School Systems.

In 1982, the credit union moved to a new location on 6th Street in downtown Gadsden. Six years later, in August 1989, the credit union received approval from the Alabama Credit Union Administration (ACUA) and the National Credit Union Administration (NCUA) to convert from a federal charter to a state charter, which allowed the credit union to change its name from Etowah Teachers to Alabama Teachers Credit Union. In July 2001, Alabama Teachers received further permission from the ACUA to expand its membership to include anyone residing, working, or attending school in the five counties we serve: Calhoun, Cherokee, DeKalb, Etowah, and Marshall.

Today
To embrace our field of membership and our strong name simultaneously, we recognized that teachers weren't just limited to educating in the traditional classroom setting, but that the act itself applied to each one of us. Therefore, in July of 2012, Alabama Teachers Credit Union introduced a new brand and image--we are all teachers--because we believe in being a student of life.

It is by our brand that we celebrate every teaching moment in life and we understand that by learning together, we enhance not only ourselves, but also each other. The enthusiasm of our credit union, members, and community has led to a continued strengthening of our membership numbers, assets, and overall financial stability.

Our Values
Alabama Teachers is a not-for-profit financial institution that provides safe, affordable and convenient financial services to its members. Because we are a cooperative, all our members are part owners of the credit union and have the right to democratically elect the Board of Directors, a group of volunteers who helps guide the credit union's progress. The Board of Directors sets policy and ensures the highest standard of financial services to our members.

Alabama Teachers highly values its members and is committed to providing them with competitive rates and terms, excellent member service, resourceful financial tools, and the opportunity to learn from one another. These principles play an integral part in the mission statement of Alabama Teachers.

Our Mission Statement
Alabama Teachers is a family of caring individuals dedicated to strengthening lives through financial partnerships. It is this firm commitment that allows us to embrace the teaching moments of life, because through them we can all learn together.

The Credit Union Difference
While services from a credit union such as Alabama Teachers may appear nearly the same as a bank, the structure and philosophy are very different.

Not-for-profit--Like all credit unions, Alabama Teachers is a not-for-profit financial cooperative. Unlike most other financial institutions, credit unions do not issue stock or pay dividends to outside stockholders. Instead, earnings are returned to our members in the form of lower loan rates, higher interest on deposits, and lower fees.

Taxation--Credit unions pay taxes: payroll taxes, sales taxes, and property taxes. But Congress exempts credit unions from federal income taxes. According to the Credit Union Membership Access Act, "… credit unions are member-owned, democratically operated, not-for-profit organizations generally managed by volunteer boards of directors and they have the specified mission of meeting the credit and savings needs of consumers, especially persons of modest means." 

Ownership--Each member has equal ownership and one vote--regardless of how much money a member has on deposit. 
Volunteer Boards--Alabama Teachers is governed by a board of directors, elected by and from the credit union's membership and serve voluntarily.

Membership Eligibility--By current federal statute, credit unions such as Alabama Teachers cannot serve the general public. People qualify for a credit union membership through their employer, organizational affiliations like churches or social groups, or a community-chartered credit union.
Financial Education for Members--Alabama Teachers is dedicated to helping members become better-educated consumers of financial services. 

Social Purpose: People Helping People--Credit unions exist to help people, not make a profit. Alabama Teachers' goal is to serve its members, neighbors, and communities to further enrich their financial health and overall well-being. As a member, we welcome the opportunity to help you with your everyday life goals as we all learn together.

name: CINCO Credit Union
description:
Our friendly and knowledgeable staff are people you know, you like, and you trust.  As a credit union serving the Greater Cincinnati area since 1936, CINCO always has your best interests in mind.

CINCO Credit Union has all the "banking" services you, your family, and your business need.  But we're not a bank. We're a credit union. So what's the difference? Like all credit unions, CINCO is a not-for-profit cooperative. CINCO is owned and controlled by all the people it serves. That makes a very real, everyday difference in the way you're treated.  And "not-for-profit" means just that - earnings go right back to members through more services, better rates, and more free services.  Just like the thousands of people we serve, CINCO is an integral part of the Cincinnati community, and we give back in many different ways.

To become a member, you must live, work, worship, or attend school in Hamilton, Butler, or Clermont counties in southwestern Ohio (Greater Cincinnati area), or be an employee, retiree or student of one of our Select Employee Groups. If this doesn't describe you, don't worry - there are many other paths to membership.
